item.title: Circuits II: Lecture 1
item.description: tl;dr The lecture introduced the matrix notation for KVL Basics As we already know from Circuit I, applying KVL’s law to a mesh is given by the equation: $$ \sum{v} = 0 $$ Which can be expanded further, using ohm’s law $V=IR$. $$ \sum{R_S I_S} - \sum{R_m I_m} = \sum{V_s} $$ Where $R_S$ and $I_S$ are the resistance and currents in the mesh, $R_m$ and $I_m$ are the resistance and currents in the mesh that are shared between other meshs, and $v_S$ is is the source voltage (more on polarity later).
